snippet: Libyan authorities argued Wednesday at the International Criminal Court at The Hague that Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and the former intelligence chief of Libya must be tried in their own country.
abstract: Libyan authorities argue at International Criminal Court at The Hague that Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and former intelligence chief Abdullah el-Senussi must be tried in their own country by Libyan judges;
lead_paragraph: Libyan authorities argued Wednesday at the International Criminal Court at The Hague that Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and the former intelligence chief of Libya must be tried in their own country.

headline.seo: Libya Insists on Trying Qaddafi Son
headline.main: At Hague, Libya Insists It Should Try Qaddafi Son
headline.print_headline: At Hague, Libya Insists It Should Try Qaddafi Son
